citeinfo.title: Storm Surge Exposure for a Category 2 like event in 2100
Copano and San Antonio Bays Sea Level Rise Analyses

descript.abstract: This dataset was made to show the percentage of each census block in Copano and San Antonio Bays that are potentially exposed to a storm surge scenario similar to Category 2 storms, intensified by 0.82 m of SLR. The storm surge data originated from Maloney & Preston (2014) of Oak Ridge National Laboratory who shared data of storm surge exposure consistent with the SRES A1fi scenario (82 cm). No public data on storm surge exposure for sea level rise of 1 m by 2100 scenario was available for this study as no additional modeling was conducted to create site specific storm surge data for 1 m sea level rise scenario. Exposure is classified between Low (15%) based on percent of block group area inundated.
descript.purpose: Dataset was created to determine the condition of the Copano and San Antonio Bays landscape under the a 2100 sea level rise scenario and used for analyses of marsh resiliency, coastal resiliency, and community resiliency.

idinfo.accconst: Data access will be granted on gulfsealevelrise.org and coastalresilience.org and will follow the data access constraints on those two websites.
idinfo.useconst: Data use will be granted on gulfsealevelrise.org and coastalresilience.org and will follow the data use constraints on those two websites.
idinfo.datacred: This project is funded by GLO Contract No. 15-032-000-8374 and is supported by data collected by research staff of the Coastal Studies group, Near Surface Observatory, Bureau of Economic Geology, Jackson School of Geosciences, The University of Texas at Austin. This project was supported by grant no. 13-268-000-7485 from the General Land Office of Texas to the BEG. Jeffrey G. Paine served as the principal investigator. The project was funded under a Coastal Impact Assistance Program grant made available to the State of Texas by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

procstep.procdesc: Development of the data set by the agency / individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of storm surge within census block in acres
Percent cover of storm surge in census block
Exposure range for storm surge percentage: 0-0.1% = None; 0.11-4.99% = Low; 5.0-14.99%=Medium; 15.0-100% = High

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
